case_vignette: A 20-year-old man comes to the physician because he believes he has low testosterone. He states that he is embarrassed at his lack of musculature, despite lifting weights twice daily. Every day, he drinks a gallon of milk and several protein shakes in addition to 3 large meals. He is convinced that his female classmates at the community college he attends are secretly laughing at his scrawny appearance. Over the course of the semester, he has attended fewer and fewer classes out of embarrassment and shame. He is also concerned that his hair is thinning and applies topical minoxidil to his scalp 3 times daily. He spends 2 hours daily anxiously examining himself in the mirror. Today, he is wearing a long-sleeved shirt and a hat. His BMI is 26 kg/m2. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. On mental status examination, he has an anxious mood and a full range of affect. Serum studies show a normal testosterone concentration.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm embarrassed about my lack of muscles despite lifting weights a lot, I think I'm losing hair, and I feel really anxious, especially about my appearance.
How old are you?
I am 20 years old.
Do you have any family history of thyroid disorders or alopecia (hair loss)?
The case vignette does not mention any family history of health conditions, so I don't have that information.
Have you experienced any unexplained weight changes recently?
No, I haven't mentioned any unexplained weight changes.
Are you currently taking any medications or have any known medical conditions?
I'm applying topical minoxidil to my scalp for hair thinning, but no other medications or known medical conditions are mentioned.
**Final Diagnosis:** Body Dysmorphic Disorder with Muscle Dysmorphia and male pattern hair loss (androgenetic alopecia)
